intro: Lastrea euaensis, commonly known as the Euaensis Lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
